author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a move to step up security at the Chennai Central railway station, police have installed a new system — Under Vehicle Scanning System (UVSS). It was acquired and installed at the entry point on V.O.C. Salai (Wall Tax Road).

“We had submitted our proposal last year itself, but it was approved now,” said an officer of Railway Protection Force (RPF). The UVSS has a digital line scan camera and a sturdy weatherproof x-ray unit that scans the vehicle’s chassis. It also scans both the front and back registration plates. The driver’s face is also recorded in the megapixel camera installed in the front. “The monitor is manned by a policeman round the clock,” he said.

The system will also help track crime and property offenders on the run as the numbers and photographs of the vehicle and driver will be automatically recorded, the officer said.

“In case of such events, police officials can make use of the data and help track suspects,” the official said.

“We have not come across any suspicious vehicles so far, but we are vigilant,” the officer added.
title: Vehicle scanner at Chennai Central
